core: The answer lives underneath the noise—slow down enough to hear it.
Trust your inner knowing; it may be quiet, but it is consistent.
Let your intuition lead your next choice, then confirm it through lived experience.
You don’t need to explain your knowing to honor it.
You may be second-guessing yourself or looking outside for permission to trust what you already sense.
Return to stillness: fewer inputs, more body cues, more honest silence.
Name what you already know, then take one small action that proves it to you.
If you keep overriding your signals, the confusion will deepen instead of clearing.
